result.execSummary:
The defendant Xavier M Bean was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Expungement to be granted after successful completion of probation and repayment of at least one half of ordered restitution.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all court costs, fees and surcharges, and mandatory DNA surcharge (both counts).
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANICAL OBLIGATIONS:  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.  Payment plan for all monetary obligations to be established by DOC, probation and parole with restitution having first priority of payment, all other monetary obligations having priority thereafter.  All unpaid balances at the end of the probationary period will convert to a civil judgment.
No violent contact with victim Willie C. and contact to be had with victim only with his permission.
Pay all applicable fees of supervison (both counts).  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Xavier M Bean

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Xavier M Bean in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Janet C. Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
-  AMENDED INFORMATION, FILED.
COUNT 1 AMENDED to Theft (Value Not Exceeding $2,500) - PTAC, As A Party To A Crime, contrary to 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a), 939.51(3)(a), 939.05, Wisconsin Stats, a CLASS A MISDEMEANOR.

COUNT 2 ADDED/AMENDED as Criminal Damage To Property (Less Thank $2,500 Damage) - PT, As A Party To A Crime, contrary to 943.01(1).39.51(3)(a), 939.05, Wisconsin Stats, a CLASS A MISDEMEANOR.

UNCHARGED COUNT READ IN FOR SENTENCING PURPOSES:  Possession of Cyclobenzaprine.

AS TO AMENDED/ADDED COUNTS 1 and 2, Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the state and defense counsel. 
-  Victim Impact Statement, FILED.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION. Credit for 3 DAYS time served. COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 18 MONTHS.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 2
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT 1. Credit for 0 DAYS time served. COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 18 MONTHS,CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1.
.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department;
-obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation;
-no VIOLENT contact with victim, Willie C, and contact to be had with victim only with his permission;
-pay restitution in the stipulated amount of $1,140.00 to Willie C, failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (both counts); failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-pay MANDATORY DNA surcharge (both counts); failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-pay all applicable fees of supervision (both counts); failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
-
-  Payment Plan for all monetary obligations to be established by Department of Corrections, Probation and Parole, with restitution having first priority of payment, all other monetary obligations having priority thereafter,.  All unpaid balances at the end of the probationary period will convert to a civil judgment.
-  Civil Judgment Warning given.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter. 
-  Expungement to be granted after successful completion of probation and repayment of at least one-half of Ordered Restitution. 

Appeal rights given. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copy given to defendant.

Defendant Xavier M Bean in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Janet Claire Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 03-31-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Xavier M Bean in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas, who appears by telephone.  Janet Claire Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Status conference scheduled for 02-20-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 1/27/14.

Defendant Xavier M Bean in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas. Kerri Puig, student intern under the supervision of Marissa Santiago for Janet Claire Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Colliers Creations Barber and Salon

Defendant Xavier M Bean in court with attorney Vincent Guimont.  Defendant Xavier M Bean in custody.  Dax C. Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Xavier M Bean
Current: 3703 N 1st Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212   (Effective: 01-15-2014)
Prior: 2236 North 29th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
